concept_harvest_40.summary: Treat runtime self-reports as non-authoritative for high-impact trust decisions; require independent attestors.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Closes self-trust blind spot in compromised-host scenarios such as GSS-021.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Require m-of-n independent approvals for irreversible or high-blast-radius policy mutations.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Reduces single-point compromise and coerced single-principal actions (GSS-023).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Accept critical state only when corroborated by mutually independent witnesses with fault tolerance.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Improves trust decisions under adversarial uncertainty and spoofing.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Track artifact lineage from source to deploy with signed attestations and reproducible build constraints.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Mitigates malicious dependency introduction and silent semantic drift (GSS-021).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Encode hard safety constraints as runtime barrier predicates that cannot be crossed by optimization pressure.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Prevents optimization from violating safety envelopes under urgency.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Trip high-risk paths under repeated instability, then require explicit cool-down evidence before re-enable.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Reduces retry storms and oscillatory failures in crisis periods.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Define deterministic degraded modes that preserve safeguards while reducing capability surface.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Closes unsafe-fallback gap when policy or infra dependencies fail (GSS-012).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Mandate sequence patterns that prefer reversible probes before irreversible commitments during emergencies.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Improves decisions under sparse evidence and time pressure (GSS-001, GSS-006).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Structure policies so honest reporting and compliant behavior dominate strategic misreporting.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Hardens against strategic exploitation of policy loopholes.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Use challenge designs where adversaries pay higher costs than legitimate actors to produce convincing claims.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Improves anti-spoofing and anti-coercion confidence calibration (GSS-002, GSS-003).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Model attacker ROI and shift system economics to make exploitation unattractive.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Addresses Goodhart-by-adversary where attackers optimize against visible policy rules.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Treat attacker-defender interaction as repeated game and refresh defenses from observed strategy adaptation.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Improves adaptation quality under evolving attacker tactics.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Bias communication and sequencing toward stabilization, consent, and reduced cognitive overload in crises.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Reduces harm from technically correct but psychologically damaging interactions.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Replace binary capable/incapable assumptions with assistive ladders that preserve autonomy while adding safeguards.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Closes autonomy-vs-protection gap for cognitive decline and dependent-care scenarios (GSS-014, GSS-016).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Trigger renewed consent and confirmation when contextual signs indicate reduced decisional capacity.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Prevents stale or manipulated consent from authorizing harmful actions (GSS-023).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Constrain interventions to the least intrusive action that still satisfies safety obligations.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Addresses paternalism risk while preserving safety in vulnerable-user contexts.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Define non-negotiable constraints with explicit amendment supermajority and evidence requirements.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Prevents ad hoc erosion of foundational safeguards under pressure.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Insert time-delayed confirmation windows for high-impact policy changes to reduce impulse and manipulation effects.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Mitigates coercion and panic-induced misconfiguration by authenticated principals (GSS-023).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Require independently situated reviewers for high-impact changes and block approvals with role conflict.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Reduces insider abuse and single-actor failure modes in policy governance.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Expire emergency powers and exceptional policies automatically unless re-justified with fresh evidence.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Prevents emergency exceptions from becoming silent permanent authority expansion.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Maintain evidence chains where compromise of current key cannot rewrite prior authenticated history.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Hardens audit records against retroactive tampering (GSS-024).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Store evidence as Merkle-indexed bundles enabling selective disclosure with integrity-preserving proofs.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Improves verifiability with minimal disclosure in legal and privacy-sensitive contexts.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Replicate critical audit checkpoints into independently administered append-only stores.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Provides survivability when primary evidence store is corrupted or captured (GSS-024).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Use redundant coding and parity checkpoints to recover partial history after integrity chain breaks.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Maintains continuity of learning and compliance after storage faults or targeted corruption.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Detect gradual behavioral drift using online tests over decision distributions and explanation semantics.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Closes slow-poisoning blind spot where no single update exceeds thresholds (GSS-022).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Distinguish policy effects from background shifts by tagging and evaluating deliberate interventions.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Prevents spurious attribution in adaptation loops.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Decompose regrets by decision stage and information availability to isolate controllable failure sources.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Improves recurrence reduction quality by separating policy defects from data scarcity.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Constrain adaptation trials with explicit horizon, rollback triggers, and blast-radius caps.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Prevents unsafe adaptation during active crises and high-risk windows.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Represent normative conflicts as typed obligations, prohibitions, and permissions with deterministic reduction rules.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Addresses unresolved law collisions in edge cases (GSS-025).

concept_harvest_40.summary: Apply explicit precedence ordering and require proof artifacts for each overridden norm.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Prevents arbitrary conflict resolution and hidden policy drift.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Constrain decisions by similarity to precedent cases while requiring explicit justification for deviations.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Improves consistency and replay-compatibility across rare conflict scenarios.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Allow rapid temporary overrides with mandatory post-hoc review and reversible escrowed effects.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Balances urgent action with legitimacy and accountability.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Institutionalize near-miss capture and weak-signal escalation before incidents become high-impact failures.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Reduces latent defect accumulation and surprise failures.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Assign explicit responder roles and escalation authority under crisis to reduce coordination failures.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Improves high-pressure execution consistency for urgent scenarios.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Pair non-punitive analysis with enforceable remediation commitments and verification deadlines.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Ensures learning loops produce measurable hardening, not narrative-only retrospectives.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Tailor explanation granularity to urgency and user state while preserving minimum accountability fields.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Prevents explanation overload that can degrade decision quality in emergencies.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Stop evidence gathering once expected decision improvement falls below urgency-adjusted threshold.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Reduces costly over-deliberation when action urgency dominates.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Prioritize queue service by risk and reversibility rather than arrival order alone.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Prevents low-risk noise from starving urgent high-risk tasks.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Choose scheduling policies that cap worst-case lateness for safety-critical decision windows.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Improves predictability under bursty emergency demand.

concept_harvest_40.summary: Set optimization guardbands and pair each KPI with anti-metric and oversight channel.
concept_harvest_40.gap_addressed: Hardens adaptation against Goodhart drift and one-dimensional metric gaming.

synthesis_families_10.name: Independent Integrity and Attestation
synthesis_families_10.unifying_claim: High-impact trust decisions should depend on independent integrity witnesses, not single-runtime self-assertions.
tradeoffs: Higher verification latency for critical actions.
Additional operational complexity in key and witness management.

synthesis_families_10.name: Safety Envelope Dynamics
synthesis_families_10.unifying_claim: Runtime behavior needs explicit dynamic safety envelopes that degrade capability before safeguards.
tradeoffs: Can reduce throughput and user-perceived responsiveness.
Requires accurate boundary tuning to avoid false lockouts.

synthesis_families_10.name: Adversarial Incentive Robustness
synthesis_families_10.unifying_claim: Security posture improves when policy design assumes strategic optimization by adversaries and counterparties.
tradeoffs: Stronger checks can increase user friction.
Threat-model maintenance cost rises with ecosystem complexity.

synthesis_families_10.name: Vulnerability-Centered Human Safeguards
synthesis_families_10.unifying_claim: Human protection quality increases when autonomy, dignity, and vulnerability are modeled as first-class decision variables.
tradeoffs: Requires richer contextual assessment and explanation payloads.
Risk of overprotective paternalism if guardrails are not balanced.

synthesis_families_10.name: Constitutional Governance Controls
synthesis_families_10.unifying_claim: Policy mutation safety requires constitutional friction, separation of duties, and automatic expiry of exceptional authority.
tradeoffs: Slower emergency adaptation if exception paths are underspecified.
Added governance overhead for low-risk changes.

synthesis_families_10.name: Evidence Continuity and Forensic Survivability
synthesis_families_10.unifying_claim: Audit trust requires tamper-evident, recoverable, and independently witnessable evidence chains.
tradeoffs: Storage and replication overhead.
Higher complexity for retention, privacy, and disclosure workflows.

synthesis_families_10.name: Drift-Aware Learning Under Uncertainty
synthesis_families_10.unifying_claim: Safe adaptation requires explicit drift detection, causal attribution, and bounded exploration policies.
tradeoffs: More instrumentation and experimentation overhead.
Potentially slower policy iteration speed.

synthesis_families_10.name: Deterministic Norm Conflict Resolution
synthesis_families_10.unifying_claim: Normative conflicts should resolve through deterministic, auditable rules that preserve reversibility and appeals.
tradeoffs: Formal rule design can underfit rare edge cases.
Appeal pathways can increase operational cycle time.

synthesis_families_10.name: Socio-Technical Reliability Discipline
synthesis_families_10.unifying_claim: Reliability depends on organizational signal capture, clear crisis roles, and cognitively usable explanations.
tradeoffs: Requires ongoing process training and governance rituals.
Potential increase in upfront operational documentation effort.

synthesis_families_10.name: Bounded Multi-Objective Optimization
synthesis_families_10.unifying_claim: Decision quality improves when compute, latency, and utility objectives are optimized with explicit anti-Goodhart guardbands.
tradeoffs: Needs higher quality telemetry and calibration pipelines.
May reduce maximum short-term throughput for safer tail behavior.

combined_concepts_5.name: External Integrity Envelope
combined_concepts_5.core_rule: No T2/T3 privileged mutation is admissible unless integrity state is corroborated by independent witnesses and evidence lineage remains continuous.
combined_concepts_5.why_now: GSS-021 and GSS-024 expose a kernel self-trust blind spot where compromise or chain corruption invalidates internal assertions.
blind_spots_closed: Self-referential trust loops during host compromise.
Weak integrity guarantees for post-incident forensics.
failure_modes_if_omitted: Unverifiable forensic narratives after chain break.
Privilege decisions made on forged or stale integrity signals.
countermetrics: Pair integrity-pass-rate with false-lockdown-rate and mean-recovery-time.
Track attestation freshness distribution, not just binary pass/fail.
Audit witness diversity index to prevent monoculture attestation failures.

combined_concepts_5.name: Constitutional Friction for Root Authority
combined_concepts_5.core_rule: Authenticated root instructions may request but not instantly enact high-impact policy mutation; enactment requires cooling-off, sandbox evidence, and dual-control or documented emergency exception.
combined_concepts_5.why_now: GSS-023 shows that authenticated principals can be manipulated into dangerous but syntactically valid policy changes.
blind_spots_closed: Assumption that root_human intent is always unmanipulated.
Lack of constitutional friction for irreversible policy mutation.
Missing deterministic exception governance under urgency.
failure_modes_if_omitted: Coerced policy escalations executed without delay.
Permanent emergency exceptions with silent authority expansion.
Inconsistent conflict handling across equivalent root requests.
countermetrics: Pair policy-change throughput with post-change rollback-rate.
Track emergency-exception frequency with independent review reversal-rate.
Measure cooling-off bypass count segmented by risk tier.

combined_concepts_5.name: Semantic Drift Budget and Re-Consent
combined_concepts_5.core_rule: Behavioral and policy evolution must stay within declared semantic drift budgets; threshold crossings require explicit re-consent or delegate quorum before further adaptation.
combined_concepts_5.why_now: GSS-022 and GSS-014 reveal slow, individually-benign updates can accumulate into dangerous behavioral divergence.
blind_spots_closed: No cumulative drift cap across many small updates.
Insufficient re-consent triggers for capacity decline contexts.
Weak distinction between legitimate adaptation and adversarial poisoning.
failure_modes_if_omitted: Persona poisoning remains undetected until catastrophic divergence.
Owner intent is inferred from stale or compromised preference traces.
Adaptation loops optimize proxy metrics while degrading human alignment.
countermetrics: Pair adaptation gain with semantic-divergence velocity.
Track drift-threshold crossings with false-positive review burden.
Monitor re-consent completion latency and override frequency.

combined_concepts_5.name: Vulnerability-Weighted Reversible Intervention
combined_concepts_5.core_rule: As vulnerability and uncertainty increase, policy must shift toward reversible, low-regret interventions with stricter explanation and oversight requirements.
combined_concepts_5.why_now: GSS-001, GSS-006, GSS-015, and GSS-016 require safe action under uncertainty without sacrificing dignity or autonomy.
blind_spots_closed: Uniform risk thresholds across unequal human vulnerability states.
Insufficient explanation obligations during high-stress decisions.
Over-reliance on irreversible interventions under ambiguous evidence.
failure_modes_if_omitted: Technically legal but humanly harmful interventions.
countermetrics: Pair safety-incident reduction with autonomy-override rate.
Track reversible-first compliance alongside delayed-harm incidents.
Measure explanation adequacy score against action latency.

combined_concepts_5.name: Deterministic Conflict Proof Engine
combined_concepts_5.core_rule: When laws, principles, or directives conflict, resolve through deterministic precedence lattice and emit machine-checkable proof objects that include rejected alternatives.
combined_concepts_5.why_now: GSS-025 makes explicit that unresolved normative conflicts are a primary correctness and trust risk.
blind_spots_closed: Ad hoc conflict decisions that cannot be replayed.
Missing evidence for why one norm overrode another.
No standardized audit artifact for post-incident governance review.
failure_modes_if_omitted: Post-hoc reviewers cannot verify rationale legitimacy.
Conflict handling silently drifts with prompt/context variance.
countermetrics: Pair conflict-resolution speed with appeal-upheld rate.
Track proof completeness score with operator comprehension score.
Measure deterministic-replay pass rate for conflict cases.

add.name: External Integrity Witnessing
add.title: Treat self-measurement as non-authoritative under high risk
add.statement: T2/T3 privileged actions require fresh out-of-band integrity attestation and independent witness corroboration before execution.

add.name: Constitutional Friction for Dangerous Policy Mutation
add.title: Require deliberative friction for high-impact root changes
add.statement: Root-authorized high-impact policy changes must pass cooling-off, sandbox simulation, and dual-control unless emergency exception evidence is explicitly recorded.

add.name: Semantic Drift Budgeting
add.title: Limit cumulative behavior drift and trigger re-consent
add.statement: Policy and persona evolution must remain within declared semantic drift budgets; threshold crossings require owner re-consent or delegated quorum approval.

add.name: Vulnerability-Proportional Reversibility
add.title: Increase care obligations as vulnerability rises
add.statement: As assessed human vulnerability increases, policy must tighten irreversible action thresholds, prefer reversible alternatives, and emit stronger explanation artifacts.

add.name: Deterministic Conflict Proofs
add.title: Resolve law and value conflicts with proof artifacts
add.statement: When normative conflicts are detected, execute deterministic precedence rules and emit a proof object linking chosen resolution, rejected alternatives, and supporting evidence.

MECH-INTEGRITY-ATTESTATION.purpose: Independent host and supply-chain integrity verification before T2/T3 actions

MECH-EVIDENCE-CONTINUITY.purpose: Tamper-evident and recoverable evidence chains with independent witness replication

MECH-POLICY-CHANGE-SANDBOX.purpose: Simulate and score high-impact policy changes under cooldown and dual-control constraints

MECH-SEMANTIC-DRIFT-GUARD.purpose: Enforce cumulative drift budgets and mandatory re-consent triggers

MECH-CONFLICT-RESOLUTION-LATTICE.purpose: Deterministic law/principle conflict resolution with proof-object emission

merge.INV-07: No T2/T3 privileged mutation executes without fresh independent integrity attestation.
merge.INV-08: High-impact policy changes by root_human must include cooldown or emergency override evidence before activation.
merge.INV-09: Cumulative semantic drift from approved baseline never exceeds drift_budget without re-consent artifact.
merge.INV-10: For V2/V3 vulnerability tiers, irreversible actions require recorded reversible-alternative analysis.
merge.INV-11: Every normative conflict resolution emits deterministic proof object with rejected alternatives.

add.escalation_rule: Any T2/T3 action with failed attestation, unresolved conflict, or V3 vulnerability without reversible path escalates to fail-closed unless emergency exception proof exists.

conflicts_and_resolution_meta_policy.tension: LAW-03 durability-before-acknowledgment versus LAW-18 reversibility when durable commit itself is irreversible.
conflicts_and_resolution_meta_policy.resolution_rule: Prefer reversible commitment staging: acknowledge only after durable record of compensator plan and operator-visible rollback alternatives when direct rollback is impossible.

conflicts_and_resolution_meta_policy.tension: Authenticated owner intent versus coercion/manipulation risk under LAW-14 graded trust.
conflicts_and_resolution_meta_policy.resolution_rule: Treat root intent as high-weight but challengeable signal; require step-up checks and cooling-off for high-impact changes when coercion indicators exceed threshold.

conflicts_and_resolution_meta_policy.tension: Privacy minimization and least disclosure versus urgent safety intervention.
conflicts_and_resolution_meta_policy.resolution_rule: Apply necessity-and-proportionality test: disclose minimum data required for immediate harm reduction, then trigger post-incident minimization review.

conflicts_and_resolution_meta_policy.tension: Adaptation speed for liveness versus guarded adaptation and invariant preservation.
conflicts_and_resolution_meta_policy.resolution_rule: Allow rapid adaptation only inside sandboxed horizon with explicit rollback gates; promotion requires measured improvement and invariant pass.

conflicts_and_resolution_meta_policy.tension: Deterministic consistency versus empathy-sensitive contextual discretion.
conflicts_and_resolution_meta_policy.resolution_rule: Keep decision procedure deterministic while allowing bounded empathy parameters as explicit inputs; prohibit untracked free-form override.

Add INV-07 and INV-11 checks to runtime gate evaluation and replay tests.
Introduce MECH-POLICY-CHANGE-SANDBOX plus cooldown and dual-control enforcement for high-impact root changes.
Add PRIN-054 and PRIN-055 to principles bundle and bind to defect taxonomy checks.
Implement MECH-SEMANTIC-DRIFT-GUARD with drift budget thresholds and re-consent triggers.
Add PRIN-056 and risk_model modifiers for semantic drift velocity and integrity status.
Integrate vulnerability tiering and PRIN-057 into orientation compilation and decision explanation contracts.
Implement conflict_resolution_lattice and MECH-CONFLICT-RESOLUTION-LATTICE proof artifacts.
Add PRIN-058 and corresponding deterministic conflict replay tests.
Roll out new metrics and anti-Goodhart countermetric dashboards with staged enforcement gates.
